result.execSummary:
The defendant Mario Eugene Bianchetti was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Violate/Harassment Restraining Order, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 813.125(7).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Huber release if in compliance with the jail rules and regulations.
Good time.

If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.

miscConds.notes:
May not be in any establishment whose primary purpose is the sale of alcohol.
Refrain from any alcohol, prescription or illegal drugs.  May take prescriptions according to doctor's orders after approved by supervisor.

Comply with any assessments and follow through.
Comply with injunction and any other court orders.
All communication with victim must be through Our Family Wizard.
Defendant must advise Court Commissioner that the Court has ordered this.  Must set up Our Family Wizard.
Provide DNA sample today (10-16-2015).

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea
